paragraphs: The German low-cost airline Eurowings will launch two new flights from Prague. Starting from November 7, 2025, the carrier will begin flying to Beirut (the capital of Lebanon), and from November 8, to Marrakech (the fourth largest city in Morocco).
Both directions will be serviced by an Airbus A320 aircraft. This was announced by the press service of Prague's Václav Havel Airport on Tuesday, August 26th.
In Beirut, the carrier will fly once a week - on Fridays.
The travel time will be 3 hours and 35 minutes.
The cost of a one-way flight starts from 2240 kronor.
The flight to Marrakesh will operate twice a week - on Thursdays and Saturdays.
The duration of the flight will be 4 hours and 30 minutes.
The cost of tickets at the base fare is currently unknown, the airline will announce it later.

Let's remind that direct flights between Prague and Marrakesh were suspended with the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic. At that time, the route was serviced by the Irish low-cost airline Ryanair, and the cost of a one-way flight was around 1000-1500 Czech crowns.
